item.title: Hewlett-Packard Kills webOS Devices to Save webOS
item.description: Hewlett-Packard Kills webOS Devices to Save webOS http://t.co/bbaJCbP
item.content:encoded: Hewlett-Packard Kills webOS Devices to Save webOS http://t.co/bbaJCbP Hewlett-Packard released its quarterly earning statement today and tucked in the middle of the press release was a little bombshell: "HP reported that it plans to announce that it will discontinue operations for webOS devices, specifically the TouchPad and webOS phones. HP will continue to explore options to optimize the value of webOS software going forward." As they say, another one bites the dust. Or does it? HP is getting out of the mobile hardware business. This comes a week after Nokia said that it would discontinue Symbian phones in the U.S. In reality this does not change the U.S.... Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: readwriteweb.com

item.title: ABC crew killed in chopper crash - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)
item.description: BREAKING: ABC crew killed in chopper crash - ABC http://t.co/AbSNPLv #auspol #springst Thoughts to families, friends and colleges #ABCNews
item.content:encoded: BREAKING: ABC crew killed in chopper crash - ABC http://t.co/AbSNPLv #auspol #springst Thoughts to families, friends and colleges #ABCNews Veteran ABC journalist Paul Lockyer, pilot Gary Ticehurst and cameraman John Bean are believed to have died in a helicopter crash in remote South Australia. The ABC crew's helicopter is believed to have crashed around 7:30pm yesterday near Lake Eyre in the state's north. This morning ABC managing director Mark Scott said the ABC feared the worst and paid tribute to the men, who he called three news gatherers at the peak of their craft. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: abc.net.au

item.description: BREAKING: DHS Sec announces changes that could halt deportations for some same-sex couples: http://t.co/2aNMx8G #lgbt
item.content:encoded: BREAKING: DHS Sec announces changes that could halt deportations for some same-sex couples: http://t.co/2aNMx8G #lgbt Responding on behalf of President Barack Obama, Homeland Security Secretary Janet Napolitano today sent a letter to Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid detailing that the department is in the process of implementing changes to enable the government to focus its resources on high-priority immigration cases involving crime and other public safety concerns. A senior administration official says the changes are aimed at moving prosecutorial discretion exercised by immigration enforcement officials from an ''ad hoc'' system to a system focused on Link - Trackbacks
